definition: to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Such a work style is unpopular anywhere.
sentences.chinese: 这种工作作风到哪儿都吃不开。

definition: to be popular/to be getting on well/much in demand
(fig.) adaptable/able to deal with various kinds of people and situations/(derog.) insincere/two-faced
pinyin: jian4 ren2 shuo1 ren2 hua4 , jian4 gui3 shuo1 gui3 hua4
related.word: 见人说人话，见鬼说鬼话

definition: (coll.) meek and civil in public, but a tyrant at home
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
like a fish back in water (idiom); glad to be back in one's proper surroundings
to talk glibly/to talk big/to be all talk
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
